docs.text:
Welcome to MkDocs


For full documentation visit 
mkdocs.org
.


Commands




mkdocs new [dir-name]
 - Create a new project.


mkdocs serve
 - Start the live-reloading docs server.


mkdocs build
 - Build the documentation site.


mkdocs help
 - Print this help message.




Project layout


mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name]  - Create a new project.  mkdocs serve  - Start the live-reloading docs server.  mkdocs build  - Build the documentation site.  mkdocs help  - Print this help message.
docs.title: Commands

docs.text:
Integration for Dynamics CRM
 is a free WordPress plugin that integrates Microsoft Dynamics CRM. It allows submitting data from WordPress to your Dynamics CRM organization and retrieving it back into WordPress.






Features


Installation
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text:
Using the WordPress Admin to install plugins is the most straightforward option, as it handles the file transfer without you needing to leave the Web browser.


Install WordPress CRM (The easy way)




Download
 the plugin (.zip file)


Log in
 to your WordPress Admin panel


In your Admin, go to menu 
Plugins 
 Add New


Select
 the tab "Upload plugin"


Upload
 the WordPress CRM Plugin.zip file you just downloaded


Activate
 the plugin


A new 
setting item
 "Dynamics CRM" will appear in Settings tab




FTP Setup (The old way)


It’s possible at this stage that you’ll be taken to a page requesting FTP details of your webserver. This happens if you’ve not installed a plugin on this particular installation of WordPress. If that’s the case, fill in your details to complete installation.




Download
 the plugin (.zip file)


Unzip
 the folder and Upload 
wordpress-crm
 folder to the 
/wp-content/plugins/
 directory


Activate
 the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress


A new 
settings item
 "Dynamics CRM" will appear in the navigation bar
docs.title: Installation

docs.text: Download  the plugin (.zip file)  Log in  to your WordPress Admin panel  In your Admin, go to menu  Plugins   Add New  Select  the tab "Upload plugin"  Upload  the WordPress CRM Plugin.zip file you just downloaded  Activate  the plugin  A new  setting item  "Dynamics CRM" will appear in Settings tab
docs.title: Install WordPress CRM (The easy way)

docs.text: It’s possible at this stage that you’ll be taken to a page requesting FTP details of your webserver. This happens if you’ve not installed a plugin on this particular installation of WordPress. If that’s the case, fill in your details to complete installation.   Download  the plugin (.zip file)  Unzip  the folder and Upload  wordpress-crm  folder to the  /wp-content/plugins/  directory  Activate  the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress  A new  settings item  "Dynamics CRM" will appear in the navigation bar
docs.title: FTP Setup (The old way)

docs.text:
On this page we're going to walk through all the settings available to you in Integration for Dynamics CRM Plugin. You'll find information about general CRM Plugin settings as well as Connection, Login, Roles Mapping and Forms settings. Please note this documentation is relevant for version 0.9.13 and later.


To configure the plugin go to 
WordPress Admin 
 Dynamics CRM.
 Then walk through the documentation below in each section to get information on every setting.


Connection settings


On this tab you have some simple and basic settings for establishing connection to Dynamics CRM.


Microsoft Dynamics CRM supports two security models for authentication: claims-based authentication and Active Directory authentication. The type of authentication used depends on the type of deployment your application is accessing: 
Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online
 or 
Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015.
 CRM Plugin supports both CRM Online (Deployment type: Office 365) and CRM on-premises deployment.






Deployment type


Internet Facing (On-premises) or CRM Online (Office 365). Type of deployment if your CRM hosted on Microsoft services (contoso.crm5.dynamics.com) it's includes word "dynamics" then your deployment type will be "Office 365". If CRM hosts on your domain then choose "On-premises".


CRM Server Url


Absolute url to your Microsoft Dynamics CRM, https://contoso.crm.dynamics.com for Dynamics CRM online or https://contoso.crm2015.net for on-premises deployment.


User Name


CRM systemuser login name, this user will be used to authenticate and access the CRM data, be sure that user have permissions to access Dynamics CRM.


Password


CRM systemuser password, required to authenticate to CRM.




Fill the settings fields and press the 
Save Changes
 button, after connection settings are saved, plugin will notify you that connection has been established or it’s failed to connect to Dynamics CRM with error details.
docs.title: Settings

docs.text: On this tab you have some simple and basic settings for establishing connection to Dynamics CRM.  Microsoft Dynamics CRM supports two security models for authentication: claims-based authentication and Active Directory authentication. The type of authentication used depends on the type of deployment your application is accessing:  Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online  or  Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015.  CRM Plugin supports both CRM Online (Deployment type: Office 365) and CRM on-premises deployment.    Deployment type  Internet Facing (On-premises) or CRM Online (Office 365). Type of deployment if your CRM hosted on Microsoft services (contoso.crm5.dynamics.com) it's includes word "dynamics" then your deployment type will be "Office 365". If CRM hosts on your domain then choose "On-premises".  CRM Server Url  Absolute url to your Microsoft Dynamics CRM, https://contoso.crm.dynamics.com for Dynamics CRM online or https://contoso.crm2015.net for on-premises deployment.  User Name  CRM systemuser login name, this user will be used to authenticate and access the CRM data, be sure that user have permissions to access Dynamics CRM.  Password  CRM systemuser password, required to authenticate to CRM.   Fill the settings fields and press the  Save Changes  button, after connection settings are saved, plugin will notify you that connection has been established or it’s failed to connect to Dynamics CRM with error details.
docs.title: Connection settings
